column4: someone does know about internet connection issue with ubuntu 10.04.1?

why don't you explain the problem you are having a little more
ok - first of all, the version of ubuntu isn't the problem here
what is the ip address you where using on XP
do you give that IP, or does dhcp give it for you
really I dont know, but with command ipconfig /all in xp i get : DHCP Enabled : No
very interesting, is this a desktop or a laptop ?
desktop and the network card is a realtek RTL8139/810x Family Fast Ethernet
open system->administrator->hardware drivers, is your network card listed in that tool ?
in ubuntu the list apperas empty
in ubuntu the list appears empty
ok, so in theory your card seemst to be nativly supported
in 9.04 connect to internet automatically, In another machine with the same hardware I've upgraded from 9.04 to 10.04 and I dis not have problems
in 9.04 connect to internet automatically, In another machine with the same hardware I've upgraded from 9.04 to 10.04 and I did not have problems
This does mean something? : No DHCPOFFERS received. No working leases in persistent database - sleeping.
it means your network is not serving dhcp
open your network configuration tool and look at what your default gateway and dns servers are
